docs.snippet: RAPPAPORT--Dollsey G. We celebrate the life of Dollsey Gottfried Rappaport, sweet sister of Elissa Gottfried Epstein (Lovey), and aunt of Jill Epstein White, Mark Epstein, Debra Epstein and great-aunt to their children. Dollsey was above all an in...
docs.lead_paragraph:
RAPPAPORT--Dollsey G.

We celebrate the life of Dollsey Gottfried Rappaport, sweet sister of Elissa Gottfried Epstein (Lovey), and aunt of Jill Epstein White, Mark Epstein, Debra Epstein and great-aunt to their children. Dollsey was above all an incredible mother to Nanette Rosenberg and Marjorie Rozman. Her wonderful grandchildren and great-grandchildren were the jewels of her life. She was amazing with them, and left a legacy of love of family and devotion to her religion. She was lucky to live to have great- grandchildren who lovingly called her GG. She got her wish to live long enough to welcome the family's newest addition Sammy, and knew another grandchild was on the way. She will also be remembered as a magnanimous philanthropist, and generous supporter of United Jewish Appeal and the State of Israel. Our parents Lola Mishkin Gottfried and Charles Gottfried were the inspiration of our family and are remembered now, as always.

docs.snippet: BRADLEY--David William, former Maine journalist and NYNEX executive, died at his home in Georgetown, ME on February 1, 2016. Born August 3, 1941 in Somerville, MA, he was the son of Richard and Eleanor (Sullivan) Bradley. In 1972 he joined the New...
docs.lead_paragraph:
BRADLEY--David William,

former Maine journalist and NYNEX executive, died at his home in Georgetown, ME on February 1, 2016. Born August 3, 1941 in Somerville, MA, he was the son of Richard and Eleanor (Sullivan) Bradley. In 1972 he joined the New England Telephone Company in their Employee Communications department. He held several positions with New England Telephone and New York Telephone, ending his career in 1997 as the Director of Video Services for NYNEX in New York City. He leaves behind his wife of 51 years, Elizabeth Emerson Bradley and his two daughters, Jennifer Bradley Petersen and Rebecca Jane Sethi as well as their husbands, Edward Petersen and Harneet Sethi. He also is survived by four grandchildren: Joshua and Benjamin Petersen and Hannah and Amelia Sethi. His sister Carolyn Bradley Whittaker of Hemet, CA also survives him, as do several nieces and nephews. Services will be held on Saturday, February 13, 2016 at the Lindquist Funeral Home, 1 Mayberry Lane, Yarmouth, ME at 10am. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Tate House Museum Preservation Fund would be appreciated.

headline.main: Dollar Enjoys Post-Payrolls Glow in Quiet Start to Week
headline.print_headline: Dollar Enjoys Post-Payrolls Glow in Quiet Start to Week
